entries.meaning: An act or instance of replaying (of playing something, such as a game, again); a replaying of (something).
examples: It's a no-frills, no-hype game that's not only original in concept but fun to play while providing massive replay value.

entries.meaning: A repeat or subsequent playing of some or all of something which was previously broadcast or performed, or a playing of something which was recorded, such as a live event or a television broadcast, the gameplay of a computer game, etc.

A (video or audio) recording of an action or event that is or can be replayed after being recorded; saved video footage (which is, or can be, replayed) of the gameplay of a computer game, a (portion of a) televised sports match, etc.
examples: Show us that replay one more time.

entries.meaning: (sports) A replayed match, often after the first game or match ended in a draw; a rematch.
A repetition of another event, scene, or occurrence; a recurrence or reenactment.

verbs.description: replay (third-person singular simple present replays, present participle replaying, simple past and past participle replayed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To display a recording of a previous event, especially multiple times.
